articles.author: Maggie Fick
articles.description: Novo Nordisk (NOVOb.CO) has hired Thermo Fisher (TMO.N) as its second contract manufacturer for its hugely popular weight-loss drug Wegovy, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.
articles.title: Novo hires Thermo Fisher as second manufacturer for Wegovy weight-loss drug - source

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: Bullish investors are hoping Wednesday's earnings report from chip heavyweight Nvidia (NVDA.O) can rejuvenate a U.S. stocks rally that has stumbled in recent weeks.
articles.title: Investors look to AI-darling Nvidia's earnings as US stocks rally wobbles

articles.author: Jonathan Cable
articles.description: Euro zone business activity declined far more than thought in August with the slide in Germany particularly fast, while some inflationary pressures returned, surveys showed.
articles.title: Slide in euro zone service sector sharpens ECB's rates dilemma

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Peloton Interactive (PTON.O) on Wednesday forecast first-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates as a shift in consumer spending toward travel and experiences hurt demand for its exercise equipment, sending its shares 14% down before the bell.
articles.title: Peloton forecasts first-quarter revenue below estimates on waning demand

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bath & Body Works (BBWI.N) on Wednesday warned of a steeper decline in annual sales as Americans deferred purchasing its pricier home fragrances and personal care products amid still-high inflation pinching household budgets.
articles.title: Bath & Body Works sees steeper sales drop on slowing demand

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kohl's Corp (KSS.N) beat estimates for quarterly profit on Wednesday, as leaner inventories, lower costs and fewer discounts helped the department store chain to counter a broader retail slowdown.
articles.title: Kohl's beats estimates for quarterly profit from tight inventory

articles.author: Paul Sandle, Kate Holton
articles.description: The long-running battle between Microsoft (MSFT.O) and Britain over the Activision Blizzard (ATVI.O) deal took another twist on Tuesday, raising more questions than answers about the country's approach to deals in the post-Brexit era.
articles.title: UK's handling of Microsoft deal sows doubts over post-Brexit direction

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India will make its second attempt to land on the moon on Wednesday, a mission seen as crucial to lunar exploration and the country's standing as a space power, just days after a similar Russian lander crashed.
articles.title: India counts down to crucial moon landing

articles.author: David Gauthier-Villars, Gleb Stolyarov
articles.description: A Ural Airlines Airbus landed in the Russian city of Yekaterinburg on Nov. 14 last year. Then it remained grounded on the tarmac.
articles.title: Insight: How Russia keeps its fleet of Western jets in the air

articles.author: Zarir Hussain
articles.description: A railway bridge being built in India collapsed on Wednesday killing at least 26 workers and injuring two, police said, as the state-run railway authority opened an investigation.
articles.title: At least 26 killed as railway bridge collapses in India
